sub_topic: Ligand substitution reactions in coordination chemistry
message_1: In the coordination complex [Fe(H2O)6]2+, if SCN- replaced one of the water molecules, what would be the resulting coordination number and what is the name of the resulting complex?
message_2: If SCN- replaces one of the water molecules in the coordination complex [Fe(H2O)6]2+, the resulting complex would be [Fe(H2O)5(SCN)]2+. The coordination number would remain the same, which is 6, as there are still six ligands surrounding the central Fe2+ ion (five water molecules and one SCN- ion). The name of the resulting complex would be penta-aqua-thiocyanato-iron(II) or penta-aqua-thiocyanato-ferrate(II).
